name: CNN
text:
Ocean organisms produce more than half of the world's oxygen, and absorb about a quarter of our carbon dioxide.

But when oceans absorb CO2, they become more acidic and harm marine life: https://t.co/XKtI2m3BfR #WorldOceansDay https://t.co/mDgrPcUhsa

name: CNN
text: The oceans are a significant source of both renewable energy and fossil fuels; but millions of gallons of oil are released into the oceans each year, and it can take decades for an ecosystem to recover from an oil spill: https://t.co/lpNIOoWZ8o #WorldOceansDay https://t.co/0P6fjMBJU3

name: CNN
text:
The oceans play a vital part in regulating our climate and acting as a buffer against global warming.

But the extra heat is making ocean water expand, causing sea levels to rise, threatening coastal communities and bleaching coral reefs: https://t.co/xygfj9oaPS  #WorldOceansDay https://t.co/7uL0OCQoyX

name: CNN
text:
More than 80% of the ocean is still unexplored, and researchers estimate that nine in 10 ocean species have yet to be classified.

However, pollution is damaging ecosystems and harming wildlife https://t.co/verwWFVQDM #WorldOceansDay https://t.co/4mjocIufuT

name: CNN
text:
Globally, around 15% of the protein we eat comes from seafood.

But commercial fishing has led to more than 90% of marine fish stocks becoming fully fished or overfished: https://t.co/E069gqEpBo #WorldOceansDay https://t.co/K6zkpAc1fI

name: CNN
text:
The situation may look bleak, but it's not too late to make a difference.

Experts say marine life could recover to healthy levels in the next 30 years if pressures on the world's oceans -- including climate change -- were addressed now #WorldOceansDay https://t.co/7GnUp7PaAy
